Popular Rewards Program for Air Miles Credit Cards
Besides your spending habits, the type of air miles should be other criteria you consider while comparing air miles credit cards. Among all of the air miles programs, you need to pick one that best fits your travel and flying habits. If you take a certain airline very often, such as Cathay Pacific, you may want to pick an air miles program such as Asia Miles. Here are the most popular air miles programs in Hong Kong:
Asia Miles
Asia Miles allows you to redeem flight tickets from a diverse range of airlines, including Cathay Pacific and Qatar. You can redeem travel, entertainment, lifestyle, and other rewards with your air miles credit cards.
Avios
Avios in British Airways Executive Club is cheaper than Asia Miles when redeeming short flights. Plus, they offer a household accounts program, allowing you to earn Avios with your family members.
ANA Mileage Club
ANA’s mileage program lets you redeem flight tickets under Star Alliance. The strengths of ANA program are that they require fewer miles for flights to Japan and offer you a household account.

HSBC RewardCash to Asia Miles
Step 1
First, enrol in the Mileage Programme for an annual membership fee of HK$300 and fill in your details in the online enrolment form with your Asia Miles membership number.
Step 2
Then, submit an application to transfer your RewardCash to Asia Miles either via HSBC internet banking or by post.
Step 3
Go to a participating airline’s or Asia Miles website to redeem the miles earned and choose your travel destinations.
How to earn and redeem Asia Miles
You need to first sign up as Asia Miles members. You can do so through their website or apps. Marco Polo Club members are automatically enrolled as Asia Miles members, with the same membership number.
Then you can start earning your Asia Miles from your everyday spending.
You can join programs (Join Amex Turbo Programme to earn double points for every HK$1 spending) / spend on specific category/ spend on the designated day (enjoy HK$1 = 1 Asia Mile on Mondays with Asia Miles partner restaurants) to earn miles faster.
Finally, you can start redeeming your Asia Miles. But it’s worth finding out the minimum amount of Asia Miles cardholders are required to redeem each time and the conversion fee.
Things to Know Before Converting Air Miles
Air Mile Converting Fee
A handling fee of HK$100-300 is usually charged for each mileage conversion. Some airline or frequent-flyer co-branded credit cards such as BEA Flyer World Mastercard and Citi PremierMiles Card offer a handling fee waiver.
Processing Time
Please allow enough time for mileage credits to be credited to the Member’s account. It may take between 4-6 weeks for the credits to be reflected in your account balance.
Taxes
The ticket prices under miles redemption programs exclude taxes and other fees such as the Air Passenger Departure Tax, the Passenger Security Charge, terminal building charges, and the Airport Construction Fee. The final price of a redeemed flight ticket will be adjusted based on your travel destination, which will be deducted from your credit card. Please note that different amount of air miles will be charged depending upon the seasons by air miles programs (e.g. Avios and ANA).
Frequently Asked Questions
What are the best asia miles credit cards?
Standard Chartered Cathay Mastercard (HK$2 = 1 mile on Cathay and HK Express spending) and Citi Prestige Card (HK$4 = 1 mile on overseas spending) are popular Asia Miles credit cards choices.
Are airline miles credit cards worth it?
Yes, if you are a frequent flyer who spends with a credit card. You earn air miles as you normally spend. When you have collected enough miles, you can redeem a free reward ticket. If you are a lower spender, credit cards which offer cash back/ points could be a better option than airline miles credit cards.
Which airline credit card is the easiest?
Standard Chartered Asia Miles Credit Card is the easiest to apply because it only requires HK$96,000 annual income and it offers automatic mileage conversion with no conversion fee. It also offers a relatively high earning ratio of HK$4 = 1 Asia Mile on dining, online and overseas spending. But this card is only designed for collecting Asia Miles.
How do I redeem Air Miles for flights?
You will need to transfer the points you earned to air miles via internet banking first, in order to do so, you must be a member of one of the participating frequent flyer programs. After that you will be able to search and redeem for rewards fights with different destinations, date or classes, for partner airlines that can't be redeemed online, you may call the service hotline or submit a request form to make a redemption.
How many miles do you need to get a free flight?
It depends on your travel destination and the season you travel. But in order to redeem a free return ticket, you need to collect at least 12,000 Avios points for return tickets from Hong Kong to Taiwan.
How long do my air miles stay valid?
Airline or air miles co-branded credit cards will automatically transfer the earned miles into your air miles account. For other credit cards, you need to transfer reward points into air miles yourself via e-banking or by calling the customer service hotline. Some credit cards may set an expiry date for reward points from 1-5 years (usually 2-3 years). But there are a few credit cards that have no expiry date on the points, such as DBS Black World Mastercard and American Express credit cards, giving you more time on earning points for flight tickets.
Air miles have their own expiry date as well. For Asia Miles, redeemed miles in the account will no longer expire from 1 January 2020, as long as you earn or use the miles at least once every 18 months. Avios has a similar rule which expires after 36 months in an account with no activity.
Is there anything I need to know while converting flight tickets with air miles?
The prices of flight tickets under miles redemption programs don’t include taxes and other fees, including the Air Passenger Departure Tax, the Passenger Security Charge, terminal building charges, and the Airport Construction Fee. The final price of a redeemed flight ticket will be adjusted based on your travel destination. The relevant extra costs will be deducted from your credit card. Note that some air miles programs (e.g. Avios and ANA) will set flight ticket prices based on seasons and charge you different amounts of air miles.
